title: Check-in Call
facilitator: Klaus Mager (filling in for Jerry who is in Italy)

checkIns.format: Open check-in call - no specific prompt, everyone sharing updates

personalUpdates.speaker: Jerry Michalski
personalUpdates.update: In Italy (Bergamo), Klaus hosting in his absence

personalUpdates.speaker: Jessie Upp
personalUpdates.update: DayBalancer talent/community matching platform - 400 users, pivoting to event industry for monetization, cat has UTI

personalUpdates.speaker: Karl Hebenstreit Jr.
personalUpdates.update: Working on Google Workspace for 'Today's Moonshots', finishing term papers, exploring big hairy audacious goals

personalUpdates.speaker: Mike Nelson
personalUpdates.update: Heading to Taipei for keynote at World Innovation Tech Services Alliance, then Manila, stopping in Seattle to see parents with daughter

personalUpdates.speaker: Kevin Jones
personalUpdates.update: Still in limbo post-Hurricane Helene, moving to apartment in Asheville end of month, discovered wants walkable urban life not farm, FEMA failing, community devastated and giving up, mutual aid groups collapsed

personalUpdates.speaker: Ken Homer
personalUpdates.update: Got Spanish visa appointment after 3 months trying, planning to move to Valencia December/January, excited about walkable clean city with great public transit

communityBuilding.description: Challenges of coordinating community initiatives and keeping momentum
keyPoints: DayBalancer trying to solve event momentum problem
Many fragmented initiatives lacking coordination
Need for sustained engagement between events

digitalLeadership.description: Need for political vision in digital era
keyPoints: Lack of coordinated digital vision causes drift in 7 directions
Clinton Administration 1993 example of effective digital leadership
Encryption conflicts: police vs privacy/security experts
Copyright conflicts in AI era
Taiwan's 5-branch government complexity
Federal money promised not coming, FEMA non-responsive
Mutual aid groups collapsed, paid workers giving up
Community gathering places gone (no grocery, post office, restaurants)
Social fabric shredding - deeply involved people walking away
Trauma in the land visible and overwhelming
Kevin escaping to Asheville city, can't bear Swannanoa anymore

urbanVsRural.description: Preference shift toward walkable urban living
keyPoints: Kevin: Loved farm for 15 years but disaster changed preference to walkable city
Ken: Moving to Valencia for walkable, clean, civilized urban life
Both emphasize walking to cafes, groceries, restaurants

scarcityVsAbundance.description: Living with scarcity mode vs abundance mindset
keyPoints: People living in scarcity mode
Everyone always has something to give
Focus on gifts not just needs

storiesShared.summary: Built passion project without monetization plan, now has 400 users, realized it needs to pivot to events industry. Conversation with Dave at Campfire about giving gifts to community
storiesShared.impact: Example of building for community first, money second

storiesShared.summary: Still no permanent housing, moving to Asheville apartment, FEMA promises unfulfilled, mutual aid collapsed, community leaders walking away including Deb Trigg (in France recuperating), Kevin giving up on Swannanoa entirely
storiesShared.impact: Darker than Call 01 - shows progression of trauma and exhaustion

storiesShared.summary: After 3 months, finally got Spanish visa appointment, planning December/January move. Loved Valencia visit - clean, green, great transit, civilized
storiesShared.impact: Positive vision - choosing walkable urban quality of life

storiesShared.summary: Speaking to 50 national IT trade associations about need for political vision in digital era, lessons from Clinton Administration 1990s
storiesShared.impact: Themes of vision, coordination, leadership in complex systems

frameworks.name: Ikigai

elements: What you can be paid for

questionsRaised: How do we coordinate fragmented community initiatives?
How do we maintain momentum between annual events?
How do we get digital political leadership and vision?
What happens to communities when federal disaster support fails?
How do we balance encryption (privacy) vs law enforcement needs?
How do we handle AI copyright issues?
What percentage of disaster-affected populations give up and leave?
